Name: China's Huawei is reportedly set to release new AI chip to challenge Nvidia amid U.S. sanctions
Excerpt: Chinese technology giant Huawei is set to challenge Nvidia with a new artificial intelligence chip amid U.S. sanctions that had sought to curb the Chinese tech giant's technological progress, according to a Wall Street Journal report.

Name: Lisa Su formally welcomes Silo AI team to AMD after completing $665 million acquisition
Excerpt: AMD CEO Lisa Su welcomed Silo AI co-founder Peter Sarlin and the entire team on X after the chip company formally completed its acquisition.

Name: xAI’s Grok can now generate images on X
Excerpt: Elon Musk-owned xAI’s Grok AI model can now generate images on X social network. Grok access is currently limited to Premium and Premium+ users on X. The text below the sample image prompts suggests that Grok is using FLUX.1 by Black Forest Labs to create these images.

Name: Google Gemini’s voice chat mode is here
Excerpt: Google is rolling out a new voice chat mode for Gemini, called Gemini Live, the company announced at its Pixel 9 event today.

Name: How ‘Deepfake Elon Musk’ Became the Internet’s Biggest Scammer
Excerpt: All Steve Beauchamp wanted was money for his family. And he thought Elon Musk could help. Mr. Beauchamp, an 82-year-old retiree, saw a video late last year of Mr. Musk endorsing a radical investment opportunity that promised rapid returns.

Name: Chinese startup WeRide gets nod to test robotaxis with passengers in California
Excerpt: WeRide has 12 active vehicles and will operate in San Jose and nearby areas. Guangzhou-based Chinese self-driving startup WeRide has received permission from California utility regulator to test driverless cars carrying passengers, according to a Reuters report today.

Name: MIT researchers release a repository of AI risks
Excerpt: In crafting laws to regulate AI, like the EU AI Act or California’s SB 1047, policymakers have struggled to come to a consensus on which risks the laws should cover.

Name: OpenAI has introduced SWE-bench Verified to evaluate AI performance
Excerpt: OpenAI announces SWE-bench Verified, a notable advancement in the field of evaluating AI models’ performance in software engineering. This initiative is part of OpenAI’s Preparedness Framework, which focuses on assessing how well AI systems can handle complex, autonomous tasks.

Name: Research AI model unexpectedly modified its own code to extend runtime
Excerpt: On Tuesday, Tokyo-based AI research firm Sakana AI announced a new AI system called "The AI Scientist" that attempts to conduct scientific research autonomously using AI language models (LLMs) similar to what powers ChatGPT.

Name: AI-Focused VC Radical Ventures Nears $800 Million Fundraise
Excerpt: Radical Ventures, a Canadian venture capital firm that made early bets on a string of hot artificial intelligence startups, has secured nearly $800 million in commitments for a new fund, according to people familiar with the plans.

Name: Waymo to double down on winter testing its robotaxis

Name: Piecing Together an Ancient Epic Was Slow Work. Until A.I. Got Involved.

Name: SAG-AFTRA Strikes Groundbreaking AI Digital Voice Replica Pact With Startup Firm Narrativ
Excerpt: SAG-AFTRA has struck a deal with AI startup Narrativ for audio voice replicas in digital advertising that the union asserts sets “a new standard” for ethical use of the technology and also makes it easy for performers to give consent and get paid.

Name: Thinking in graphs improves LLMs’ planning abilities, but challenges remain
Excerpt: This article is part of our coverage of the latest in AI research. Large language models (LLMs) have shown promise in generating basic planning steps. However, they still struggle when it comes to accomplishing complex tasks that require coordinating and planning multiple actions.

Name: Exists launches GenAI platform to create 3D games from text prompts
Excerpt: AI startup Exists unveiled its generative AI platform platform to enable anyone to create 3D games from text prompts. The idea is to enable anyone to develop high-quality 3D computer games in minutes, using simple text prompts and requiring no coding skills.

Name: Donald Trump Falsely Claims Taylor Swift Has Endorsed Him by Posting AI Images: ‘I Accept’
Excerpt: Donald Trump has posted a series of AI-generated images on his Truth Social account falsely claiming that Taylor Swift has endorsed him for president. On Sunday night, Trump shared several screenshots of X posts showing women wearing “Swifties for Trump” shirts.

Name: Trump posts AI-generated image of Harris speaking at DNC with communist flags
Excerpt: Donald Trump has taken a last-minute swipe at Kamala Harris ahead of the first day of the Democratic National Convention (DNC) in Chicago, as he posted an AI-generated image of the vice president speaking to a jam-packed crowd of Communists.

Name: Trump Promotes A.I. Images to Suggest That Taylor Swift Endorsed Him
Excerpt: Former President Donald J. Trump, who has notably harbored a grudge against the pop music megastar Taylor Swift, set the internet ablaze on Sunday when he shared social media posts suggesting that she had endorsed him and that her fans could help him win the November election.

Name: Artists’ lawsuit against Stability AI and Midjourney gets more punch
Excerpt: Many artists allege that popular generative AI services violated copyright law by training on a dataset that included their works and, in some cases, that users of these services can directly reproduce copies of the work.

Name: Midjourney launches unified AI image editor on website, more tools amid growing competition
Excerpt: As the rivalry within artificial intelligence (AI) image generation increases with the rollout of FLUX.1 and Grok-2, leading company Midjourney is rising to the challenge with a new unified AI image editor on its website.

Excerpt: The company’s flagship Yuanzheng A2 biped humanoid robot – standing at 175 centimetres and weighing 55 kilograms – is built with various sensors and powered by artificial intelligence (AI) that enables it to see and hear as well as understand text, audio and visual information.

Name: Luma drops Dream Machine 1.5 — here’s what’s new
Excerpt: Luma Labs Dream Machine has had an upgrade, although you might not see a difference on the surface. The change is an upgrade to the underlying model, taking us to version 1.5 and offering better realism, motion following, and prompt understanding.

Name: AMD buying server maker ZT Systems for $4.9 billion as chipmakers strengthen AI capabilities
Excerpt: AMD is buying server maker ZT Systems in a cash-and-stock deal worth $4.9 billion as the chipmaker strengthens its artificial intelligence capacity in its efforts to compete with Nvidia.

Name: Berkeley Law is accepting applications for new AI-centered degree
Excerpt: UC Berkeley School of Law is accepting applications for its new program, set to begin next summer, which will focus on artificial intelligence, or AI.

Name: US tops AI ranking index with triple the investment, job postings as China and others: report
Excerpt: The U.S. topped another study that looked at the fastest-developing artificial intelligence (AI) industries in the world, according to a new report.

Name: ElevenLabs’ text-to-speech Reader app is now available globally
Excerpt: ElevenLabs, a startup developing AI-powered tools to create and edit synthetic voices, is making its Reader app available across the world with support for 32 languages. The app, first released in June in the U.S., the U.K.

Name: Stability AI appoints new Chief Technology Officer
Excerpt: British imaging, language, code, and audio generative AI company, Stability AI, has appointed Hanno Basse as its new Chief Technology Officer (CTO).

Name: Anysphere, a GitHub Copilot rival, has raised $60M Series A at  $400M valuation from a16z, Thrive, sources say
Excerpt: Anysphere, a two-year-old startup that’s developed an AI-powered coding assistant called Cursor, has raised over $60 million in a Series A financing at a $400 million post-money valuation, two sources familiar with the deal told TechCrunch.

Name: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman's words haunt Claude AI : "Anthropic’s model seeks to profit from strip-mining the human expression and ingenuity behind each one of those works"
Excerpt: Maybe OpenAI CEO Sam Altman was right. It's impossible to create tools like ChatGPT without copyright content. Over the past few years, Microsoft and OpenAI have been sued multiple times over copyright infringement issues.

Name: Andreessen Horowitz leads $80 million bet on startup seeking to tame AI with copyright
Excerpt: This time around, the threat to creators comes in the form of Silicon Valley companies racing to train their AI systems by helping themselves to content available on the web—often without seeking permission.
